details.creator: veraPDF Consortium
details.name: ISO 19005-1:2005 - 6.3.3 Composite fonts - Registry and Ordering
details.description: For any given composite (Type 0) font referenced within a conforming file, the CIDSystemInfo entries of its CIDFont and CMap dictionaries shall be compatible

rule.description: For any given composite (Type 0) font referenced within a conforming file, the CIDSystemInfo entries of its CIDFont and CMap dictionaries shall be compatible. In other words, the Registry and Ordering strings of the CIDSystemInfo dictionaries for that font shall be identical, unless the value of the Encoding key in the font dictionary is Identity-H or Identity-V.
rule.test: cmapName == "Identity-H" || cmapName == "Identity-V" || (CIDFontOrdering != null && CIDFontOrdering == CMapOrdering && CIDFontRegistry != null && CIDFontRegistry == CMapRegistry)

error.message: Registry and Ordering entries in the CIDFont and CMap dictionaries of a Type 0 font are not compatible (CIDSystemInfo Ordering = %1, CMap Ordering = %2, CIDSystemInfo Registry = %3, CMap Registry = %4)
